description: Where d(m) (number of divisors, A000005) falls by at least n.
references: D. S. Mitrinovic et al., Handbook of Number Theory, Kluwer, 1996, Section II.1.3.a.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..500
example: d(12)=6, d(13)=2 gives first drop of >= 3, so a(3)=a(4)=12.
mathematica: max = 10^4; dd = Differences[Table[DivisorSigma[0, m], {m, 1, max}]]; a[n_] := Position[dd, d_ /; d <= -n, 1, 1][[1, 1]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, -Min[dd] }] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Nov 23 2015 *)
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (findIndex)import Data.Maybe (fromJust)a058199 n = fromJust $ findIndex (n <=) $ map negate a051950_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 04 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 28 2000
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Nov 29 2000
